question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 1152-1183] [Fee Calculation] Uses u128 for intermediate calculations to prevent overflow but final result cast to u64 - can u128 result exceed u64::MAX causing truncation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 1161-1165] [Conditional Transfer] If balance > 0 transfers else destroys zero balance - can destroy_zero fail if balance somehow becomes non-zero between check and destroy? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: init_staker()] [SUI Reserve Required] Requires reserve coin_type == SUI but doesn't check if staker already initialized - can double-initialization corrupt state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: init_staker()] [Treasury Cap] Takes TreasuryCap<S> but type S is not validated against reserve - can wrong treasury cap be used? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: rebalance_staker()] [No Authorization] No cap requirement so publicly callable - can attacker repeatedly rebalance to grief protocol or manipulate staking? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: rebalance_staker()] [System State] Takes &mut SuiSystemState - can rebalance be front-run during epoch boundaries to extract value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: unstake_sui_from_staker()] [Conditional Return] Early returns if coin_type != SUI without error - can this cause silent failures in batch operations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: unstake_sui_from_staker()] [Liquidity Request] Takes &LiquidityRequest but doesn't consume it - can same request be used multiple times to drain staker? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 815-817] [Silent Failure] Returns early if not SUI reserve without reverting - can caller assume success when operation actually skipped? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Struct: LendingMarket<phantom P>] [Phantom Type] P is phantom but used for type safety - can two LendingMarkets with different P values interact unsafely? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Struct: ObligationOwnerCap<phantom P>] [Cap Type Mismatch] Cap has phantom P but obligation_id is untyped ID - can cap with wrong P be used with obligation of different market? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Struct: RateLimiterExemption<phantom P, phantom T>] [Type Enforcement] Has drop ability so can be discarded - should it be consumed to ensure exemptions aren't wasted? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: deposit_liquidity_and_mint_ctokens()] [Type Parameter] Takes T and returns CToken<P, T> but P from lending_market not validated - can wrong market type P be used? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 236-262] [CToken Type] Returns Coin<CToken<P, T>> where P is from lending_market and T from function parameter - is type parameter P correctly bound? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: borrow_request()] [U64_MAX Amount] If amount == U64_MAX, calculates max borrow - can U64_MAX be confused with actual intended borrow amount? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: borrow_request()] [Max Borrow Zero] After calculating max_borrow_amount, asserts > 0 - but what if max is 0 due to health factor? Should specific error be thrown? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: withdraw_ctokens()] [U64_MAX Withdraw] If amount == U64_MAX, calculates max withdraw without asserting result > 0 - can 0 withdrawal succeed? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: max_borrow_amount()] [Triple Min] Takes min of obligation max, reserve max, and rate_limiter max - can one constraint being 0 hide more informative error from others? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: max_withdraw_amount()] [Triple Min] Same issue - can 0 from rate limiter hide health factor issue? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 414-417] [Max Calculation Override] User provides amount but if == U64_MAX it's overridden - can this cause confusion about actual borrowed amount? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Lines: 489-492] [Max Calculation Without Assert] U64_MAX triggers max calculation but unlike borrow, doesn't assert result > 0 - intentional difference? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: borrow()] [Request Fulfillment] Creates liquidity_request via borrow_request() then immediately fulfills it - can attacker interleave between these calls if they were separate transactions? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: redeem_ctokens_and_withdraw_liquidity()] [Request Pattern] Same pattern - creates request then fulfills - are these atomic or can they be split? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: fulfill_liquidity_request()] [Request Validation] Takes LiquidityRequest but doesn't validate it belongs to this reserve or market - can cross-market request fulfillment cause issues? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/lending_market.move] [Function: unstake_sui_from_staker()] [Request Reference] Takes &LiquidityRequest as reference not ownership - can request be fulfilled elsewhere while staker thinks it's consuming it? (High)
